alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 10:31PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 100 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1029 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain due to showers and isolated thunderstorms moving over Lincoln County, including the McBride burn scar. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.2 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area, including the McBride burn scar. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
